arguments.text:
Intro: Today we will demonstrate the synthesis of silver nitrate.
Step 1: Measure 50 mL of distilled water into a beaker.
Step 2: Add 5 g of silver metal to the water.
Step 3: Heat the mixture to 80 °C while stirring.
Step 4: Slowly add 10 mL of nitric acid dropwise.
Step 5: Observe the formation of a clear solution as silver dissolves.
Step 6: Cool the solution to room temperature.
Step 7: Filter the solution to remove any undissolved particles.
End: You now have an aqueous solution of silver nitrate ready for use.

Today we will demonstrate the synthesis of silver nitrate.

slides.title: Transcript
slides.html_body:
Transcript

Step 1: Measure 50 mL of distilled water into a beaker.
Step 2: Add 5 g of silver metal to the water.
Step 3: Heat the mixture to 80 °C while stirring.
Step 4: Slowly add 10 mL of nitric acid dropwise.
Step 5: Observe the formation of a clear solution as silver dissolves.
Step 6: Cool the solution to room temperature.
Step 7: Filter the solution to remove any undissolved particles.
